Detailed Description

Database handler.

Handler for all database I/O. This singleton class uses an (abstract) class for the actual storage.

Author:
Oscar van Eijk, Oveas Functionality Provider
Version:
May 15, 2007 -- O van Eijk -- initial version for Terra-Terra
Jul 29, 2008 -- O van Eijk -- Modified version for OWL

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

$  db = '',
$  usr = '',
$  pwd = '',
$  dbtype = 'MySQL' 
) [private]

Class constructor; opens the database connection.

Parameters:
[in] $srv Database server
[in] $db Database name
[in] $usr Username to connect with
[in] $pwd Password to use for connection
[in] $dbtype Database type (reserved for future use, currently only MySQL is implemented)

References ConfigHandler::get(), _OWL::init(), and _OWL::set_status().

Member Function Documentation

DbHandler::__clone (  ) 

Implementation of the __clone() function to prevent cloning of this singleton; it triggers a fatal (user)error

_OWL::check ( &$  object,
$  level 
) [protected, inherited]

This is a helper function for lazy developers. Some checks have to be made quite often, this is a kinda macro to handle that. It compares the own severity level with that of a given object. If the highest level is above a given max, a traceback and reset are performed.

Parameters:
[in] $object Pointer to an object to check against
[in] $level The maximum severity level
Returns:
True if the severity level was correct ( below the max), otherwise false

References _OWL::reset(), _OWL::set_high_severity(), and _OWL::traceback().

Referenced by SessionHandler::write().

DbHandler::close (  ) 

Close the database and disconnect from the server. This function is called on program shutdown. Although the database will be closed already by PHP, this function might be called at any time manually; is also updates the 'opened' variable.

Referenced by __destruct(), and create().

_OWL::init (  )  [protected, inherited]

This function should be called by all constuctors. It initializes the general characteristics. Status is 'warning' by default, it's up to the contructor to set a proper status; if it's still 'warning', this *might* indicate something went wrong.

References OWL::factory().

Referenced by DOMElement::__construct(), UserHandler::__construct(), SessionHandler::__construct(), LogHandler::__construct(), FileHandler::__construct(), __construct(), OWL::__construct(), and DataHandler::DataHandler().

DbHandler::prepare_delete ( $  searches = array()  ) 

Prepare a delete query. Data is taken from the arrays that are passed to this function. All fieldnames are in the format 'table#field', where the table is not yet prefixed.

Parameters:
[in] $searches Given values that have to match
Returns:
Severity level

$  tables = array(),
$  searches = array(),
$  joins = array()

Prepare a read query. Data is taken from the arrays that are passed to this function. All fieldnames are in the format 'table#field', where the table is not yet prefixed.

Parameters:

[in] $tables Tables from which will be read
[in] $searches Given values that have to match
[in] $joins Joins on the given tables

Severity level

DbHandler::prepare_update ( $  values = array(),
$  searches = array(),
$  joins = array() 
)

Prepare an update query. Data is taken from the arrays that are passed to this function. All fieldnames are in the format 'table#field', where the table is not yet prefixed.

Parameters:
[in] $values Given database values
[in] $searches List of fieldnames that will be used in the where clause. All fields not in this array will be updated!
[in] $joins Joins on the given tables
Returns:
Severity level

References extract_tablelist(), _OWL::set_status(), tablelist(), update_list(), and where_clause().

DbHandler::read ( $  flag = DBHANDLE_DATA,
&$  data,
$  quick_query = '',
$  line = 0,
$  file = '[unknown]' 
)

Read from the database. The return value depends on the flag. By default, the selected rows(s) are returned in a 2d array.

Parameters:
[in] $flag Flag that identifies how data should be returned; as data (default) or the number of rows
[out] $data The retrieved value in a formatt depending on the flag:

  • DBHANDLE_ROWCOUNT; Number of matching rows
  • DBHANDLE_FIELDCOUNT; Number of fields per rows
  • DBHANDLE_TOTALFIELDCOUNT; Total number op fields
  • DBHANDLE_DATA (default); A 2D array with all data
  • DBHANDLE_SINGLEROW; The first matching row in a 1D array
  • DBHANDLE_SINGLEFIELD; The first matching field
[in] $quick_query Database query string. If empty, $this->query is used
[in] $line Line number of this call
[in] $file File that made the call to this method
Returns:
Severity level

References dbread(), open(), and _OWL::set_status().

Referenced by table_description().

DbHandler::set_query ( $  qry  ) 

Set the database query. This function should only be used if the query is too complex to be set with any of the prepare() functions.

Parameters:
[in] $qry A complete database query. All tablenames must be prefixed (with the tablename() function)!

_OWL::traceback ( &$  text = false,
$  depth = 0 
) [inherited]

If somehwere in the nested calls an error occured, we can traceback the original failing object with this function and signal the message.

Parameters:
[out] $text Optional variable in which the message text can be stored. If not given, the text will be written to standard output
[in] $depth This paramater should be initially empty. It calculates the depth in recursive calls.
Returns:
Severity code of the failing object

References _OWL::signal().

Referenced by _OWL::check(), UserHandler::login(), and SessionHandler::read().
